message.content:
We must “filter‐down” the many transactions to only those that affect long–term (investing) cash flows. In our data most entries are operating “sale” and “purchase” transactions (or expenses, financing/interest, etc.) but among the many “Purchase” and “Sale” lines only those dealing with a long–term asset will go into the investing section. In these records the only “product” that appears to be a fixed–asset type is an “Enterprise Solution.” (For example, products like “Premium Consulting,” “Basic Consulting” or “Standard Consulting” are “consumables” or operating–in nature.) (Also note that the “Initial” entries simply set up opening balances and are not “flow” transactions.) 

Thus we scan the table and keep only the purchase (cash outflow) and sale (cash inflow) transactions that involve an “Enterprise Solution.”

Looking at the data we extract the following investing outflows (purchases of Enterprise Solution):

1. Purchase20231231007 – product “Enterprise Solution” – amount = 200,000.0  
2. Purchase20231231008 – “Enterprise Solution” – 300,000.0  
3. Purchase20231231011 – “Enterprise Solution” – 300,000.0  
4. Purchase20231231017 – “Enterprise Solution” – 100,000.0  
5. Purchase20231231018 – “Enterprise Solution” – 100,000.0  
6. Purchase20231231022 – “Enterprise Solution” – 100,000.0  
7. Purchase20231231025 – “Enterprise Solution” – 100,000.0  
8. Purchase20231231026 – “Enterprise Solution” – 300,000.0  
9. Purchase20231231029 – “Enterprise Solution” – 200,000.0  
10. Purchase20231231030 – “Enterprise Solution” – 300,000.0  

When we add these outflows:
  200,000 + 300,000 = 500,000  
  500,000 + 300,000 = 800,000  
  800,000 + 100,000 = 900,000  
  900,000 + 100,000 = 1,000,000  
  1,000,000 + 100,000 = 1,100,000  
  1,100,000 + 100,000 = 1,200,000  
  1,200,000 + 300,000 = 1,500,000  
  1,500,000 + 200,000 = 1,700,000  
  1,700,000 + 300,000 = 2,000,000  

So total cash spent on purchasing “Enterprise Solution” is 2,000,000.0.

Next we list the sales (cash inflows) in which the “Enterprise Solution” appears:

1. Sale20240106009 – “Enterprise Solution” – amount = 262,445.58  
2. Sale20240107011 – “Enterprise Solution” – 192,028.0  
3. Sale20240108015 – “Enterprise Solution” – 280,252.81  
4. Sale20240109019 – “Enterprise Solution” – 293,772.48  
5. Sale20240112024 – “Enterprise Solution” – 242,599.54  
6. Sale20240112026 – “Enterprise Solution” – 243,590.56  
7. Sale20240114030 – “Enterprise Solution” – 190,478.23  
8. Sale20240118041 – “Enterprise Solution” – 250,090.56  
9. Sale20240121048 – “Enterprise Solution” – 181,654.5  
10. Sale20240123053 – “Enterprise Solution” – 196,484.2  
11. Sale20240125058 – “Enterprise Solution” – 218,410.49  
12. Sale20240130063 – “Enterprise Solution” – 236,405.08  
13. Sale20240201071 – “Enterprise Solution” – 39,826.86  
14. Sale20240202073 – “Enterprise Solution” – 298,084.8  
15. Sale20240203075 – “Enterprise Solution” – 246,512.71  
16. Sale20240205076 – “Enterprise Solution” – 292,202.87  
17. Sale20240205078 – “Enterprise Solution” – 226,655.74  

Now let us add these inflows step‐by‐step:

• 262,445.58 + 192,028.00 = 454,473.58  
• Add 280,252.81 → 454,473.58 + 280,252.81 = 734,726.39  
• Add 293,772.48 → 734,726.39 + 293,772.48 = 1,028,498.87  
• Add 242,599.54 → 1,028,498.87 + 242,599.54 = 1,271,098.41  
• Add 243,590.56 → 1,271,098.41 + 243,590.56 = 1,514,688.97  
• Add 190,478.23 → 1,514,688.97 + 190,478.23 = 1,705,167.20  
• Add 250,090.56 → 1,705,167.20 + 250,090.56 = 1,955,257.76  
• Add 181,654.50 → 1,955,257.76 + 181,654.50 = 2,136,912.26  
• Add 196,484.20 → 2,136,912.26 + 196,484.20 = 2,333,396.46  
• Add 218,410.49 → 2,333,396.46 + 218,410.49 = 2,551,806.95  
• Add 236,405.08 → 2,551,806.95 + 236,405.08 = 2,788,212.03  
• Add 39,826.86 → 2,788,212.03 + 39,826.86 = 2,828,038.89  
• Add 298,084.80 → 2,828,038.89 + 298,084.80 = 3,126,123.69  
• Add 246,512.71 → 3,126,123.69 + 246,512.71 = 3,372,636.40  
• Add 292,202.87 → 3,372,636.40 + 292,202.87 = 3,664,839.27  
• Finally add 226,655.74 → 3,664,839.27 + 226,655.74 = 3,891,495.01  

Thus, total cash received from selling “Enterprise Solution” is 3,891,495.01.

Now the net cash flows from investing activities (based solely on these fixed–asset transactions) equals

  (Inflow from sale) – (Outflow from purchase)
  = 3,891,495.01 – 2,000,000.0
  = 1,891,495.01

So the cash flow from investing activities is a net inflow of about +1,891,495.01.

We now report the answer in the requested JSON format:

--------------------------------------------------

```json
{"solution": {"Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities": "1891495.01"}}
```
